text: Echemus lacertosus is an endemic spider species of the family Gnaphosidae that lives on Príncipe in São Tomé and Príncipe. It was first described in 1907 by Eugène Simon. Its female holotype measures 8 mm. ==References== Category:Endemic fauna of Príncipe Category:Gnaphosidae Category:Spiders of Africa Category:Taxa named by Eugène Simon Category:Spiders described in 1907
title: Echemus lacertosus
